abstract.p: Letter by Dr Carla Roncoli of University of Georgia on Aug 3 article on human-powered equipment holds article makes only passive reference to Freeplay's distribution of radios to aid agencies working in remote places; says wind-up radios are centerpiece of very innovative and successful development project that is being carried out jointly by African Center for Meteorological Application for Development and University of Oklahoma (S)

block.p: The article about human-powered equipment makes only a passing reference to Freeplay's distribution of radios to aid agencies working in remote places. Wind-up radios are the centerpiece of a very innovative and successful development project that is being carried out jointly by the African Center for Meteorological Application for Development and the University of Oklahoma. The project has distributed hundreds of radios to rural communities in the West African country of Niger, and it will be expanding to several more countries.
The writer is an anthropologist at the University of Georgia.
